programme.desc: The M-1 Selection is a MMA competition where the next generation of fighters are given the opportunity to showcase their skills on the world stage.

programme.title: Enfusion Reality Season 1, episode 3
programme.desc: All the fighters are rope-pulling with an elephant and Bruno and Drago have a very spectaculair fight at Petch Buncha stadium. The 4 female team captains have a contest in the Ice bar where the temperature is minus 10 degrees.

programme.title: Expansion Joints
programme.desc: Harland & Wolff decided to fit expansion joints into Olympic’s superstructure to protect the ships deck houses. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside tells us how they worked and why they were needed.

programme.title: Titanic's Three Bladed Propeller
programme.desc: Based on a famous 1911 photograph of Olympic in dry dock, it has always been assumed that Titanic had an identical four-bladed center propeller. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside has uncovered a Harland & Wolff document that describes a three-bladed...

programme.title: Fixing The Wireless
programme.desc: If Jack Phillips had followed the rules, the wireless set would have still been broken the night the Titanic hit the iceberg and the Carpathia may never have received the distress call in time. Instead, Jack took initiative and fixed it himself and...

programme.title: How Did Titanic Sink?
programme.desc: He’s visited the wreck more than 30 times in the last 25 years. P.H. Nargeolet gives us his personal observations about the wreck and how Titanic might have gone down.

programme.title: Did Titanic Have Inferior Steel?
programme.desc: It’s been a theory talked about for years; were the rivets and steel used in Titanic inferior? Parks looks at the science of the debate and very well may put an end to the controversy.

programme.title: The Padded Room
programme.desc: Hidden away in Titanic’s isolation hospital was a 5x6 room padded completely from top to bottom with canvas cushions. White Star didn’t talk much about the room, but Bill Sauder will tell you how it was used.

programme.title: An Experience of A Lifetime Diving Titanic
programme.desc: He was the first school teacher to dive Titanic, not once - but twice. In this very candid account, Titanic channel host Charles Haas tells us how nerves almost kept him from going. In the end, his journey to his beloved Titanic proved to be an exciting...

programme.title: Forward A Deck Promenade
programme.desc: It’s always been suggested that H&W decided to enclose the forward end of Titanic’s A deck promenade because Olympic’s first-class passengers had complained about sea spray. Mark Chirnside believes that might not be the reason and he explains why.

programme.title: How Large was Titanic?
programme.desc: Why can’t we get the numbers right after all these years? Just how big was Titanic? Bill Sauder finally sets the record straight and answers the question - Was she the largest ship in the world?

programme.title: Surprises Inside Titanic: Wrought Iron Gates on D Deck
programme.desc: Ken Marschall continues his series into the remarkable surprises he and James Cameron discovered on their 2001 and 2005 dives to Titanic.

programme.title: The Coal Burning Fire Photo
programme.desc: At the center of the new coal burning fire documentary, is the photograph that seems to show a 60 ft black mark along the side of Titanic’s hull. Famed artist, Ken Marschall, gives us his view of the photograph and the black mark.

programme.title: The Story Behind the New Titanic Photo
programme.desc: It’s been described as one of the most spectacular photographs of Titanic ever seen. Where did it come from? Andrew Aldridge will give us the backstory behind this remarkable photograph.

programme.title: Thomas Andrews’ Notes - Mark Chirnside
programme.desc: When Olympic made her maiden voyage in June 1911 from Southampton to New York, Thomas Andrews traveled onboard to observe and take notes on potential improvements for Titanic and other ships. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside reveals how the suggested...

programme.title: The J.J. Davies Bag
programme.desc: As bodies were recovered on the Mackay-Bennett, they were given a number and the personal items found on the body were put into a mortuary bag. This is the real life story of one of those bags from Body No. 200!

programme.title: The Untold Story of the Titanic Deck Chair
programme.desc: The Titanic story goes out in so many different directions and this is one of them! A Titanic deck chair, recovered by the Mackay-Bennett and later auctioned, provides us with a new Titanic Story that you might not have heard before from Craig Sopin!

programme.title: Working on the Big Movie
programme.desc: Ken Marschall takes us behind the scenes of James Cameron’s blockbuster movie Titanic. Despite the desire to get everything right, there were a few things done deliberately wrong! For the first time, Ken give us the inside story.

programme.title: The Californian Was Not the Mystery Ship
programme.desc: Molony states categorically and for all times that the Californian was not the mystery ship. No matter how you come down on this issue, this segment is a must watch! Molony gives a very detailed and fascinating argument on this historical dispute.

programme.title: Memories from the Big Movie Part 1
programme.desc: Ken Marschall take us behind the scenes for a remarkable look at the making of James Cameron’s Titanic. If you’ve ever wondered how they built the ship and everything around it to look so real, this is an episode you can’t miss.

programme.title: The Titanic Post Office
programme.desc: Titanic was carrying 3,423 sacks of mail! The mailbags contained over 7 million pieces of mail! The Sea Post Office on board the ship was big business for White Star. Craig Sopin gives us the inside story on the Royal Mail Steamer that failed to deliver...

programme.title: Was Captain Smith Legally in Command of the Titanic?
programme.desc: Senan Molony has uncovered a completely overlooked Irish document, that seems to confirm Captain Smith was not legally in command of Titanic when she sailed from Southampton on April 10, 1912.

programme.title: A Feather in the West
programme.desc: In September 2019, a team of talented Irish climbers [Chloe Condron, Kevin Kilroy, Michelle OLoughlin and Conor McGovern] travelled to the small island of Owey to explore sea cliffs that local guidebook writer Iain Miller claims, have “enough new routing potential to last at least twelve lifetimes”. ‘A Feather in the West’ is a film about their trad climbing experiences and the relatively niche pursuit of first ascents, set on the Wild Atlantic Way, off the west coast of County Donegal. (Special thanks to Pertex)

programme.title: Margalef - Climbing
programme.desc: Margalef is a little village next to the Monsant river, in Catalunya. The most amazing rocks in Europe and hundreds routes for climbing. Pure fun and climbing in this little entertaining film.

programme.title: Pierra Menta 2025 #1
programme.desc: Comme si gravir 2.250 m de dénivelé dans les montagnes du Beaufortain en ski alpinisme ne suffisait pas, les coureurs engagés sur cette 39e Pierra Menta, ont dû performer malgré des conditions météo capricieuses. Pluie, neige et brouillard se sont invités sur la 1ère des 4 étapes mais n’ont pas freiné l’enthousiasme des 430 engagés au départ d’Arêches Beaufort au niveau du plateau des Pauses.

programme.title: Nightmare Climbs - San Pantaleon (Eng)
programme.desc: Nightmare Climbs is in Valle DAosta to climb the last of four mythical climbs: in this episode, Patrick Martini and his special guests take us to the discovery of Colle San Pantaleon

programme.title: Freeride World Tour 2023 Rd1 Baqueira Beret Spain
programme.desc: The 2023 Freeride World Tour kicks off in January in its 16th season – as usual with the best freeriders all over the globe! The first stop of the tour takes place in Baqueira Beret who plays again host, following the success of last year’s inaugural event at this epic venue. Consistent snowfall and varied terrain make this world-class resort an ideal test for freeride fanatics.The judging criteria at the Freeride World Tour are: Difficulty of Line, Control, Fluidity, Jumps & Technique.

programme.title: The First Second - Gediminas Grinius
programme.desc: Running with Gediminas means exploring the mental techniques hes continuously developing to both cope with pain and get on the podiums of the worlds most difficult ultra-trails. Or how a Lithuanian veteran of the Iraq War turned weakness and trauma into personal progress by running with his mind!

programme.title: Adamello Ultra Trail 2023 - 100 km
programme.desc: The Adamello Trail is a race of 100 km of length and 6.050m of positive difference in altitude, to run in self-sufficiency, organized by the Adamello Ultratrail ASD in cooperation with the Unione dei comuni Alta Valle Camonica. The maximum time allowed to finish the race is 31 hours.

programme.title: Golden Trail Series - Chasing Dreams 2023 - Ep 3 For the first time (Eng)
programme.desc: The Dolomyths Run is back in the Golden Trail Series. Follow Elhousine Elazzaouis relentless pursuit of a Golden Trail victory, while Salomons latest gem, Malen Osa, enters the scene with hopes of being amongst the best in the world.

programme.title: Golden Trail World Series 2024 Race Recaps - Episode 5 Headlands 27k & Mammoth 26k
programme.desc: This recap is combined with two races: seventh race of the season held in Mill Valey, San Francisco, USA – Headlans 27K, and eight race of the season held in Mammoth Lakes, California, USA – Mammoth26K Trail Fest. The last chances for our athletes to score points before heading to the final.

programme.title: Super League Triathlon Arena Games 2023 Sursee part 1
programme.desc: We are in Sursee Switzerland for the second race of the 2023 Arena Games Triathlon powered by Zwift and the first journey into Europe for the year. Super League Triathlon which is partnered with World Triathlon brings you the second ever Arena Games Triathlon World Championships, with a champion to be crowned at the final in London after the first two races of the series in Montreal and Sursee.

programme.title: Racing Georgia - Ep 6 (Eng)
programme.desc: Racers are now on the longest stage of a 7-day stage race in the country of Georgia with Racing the Planet where theyre running 250 km while carrying all of their food and supplies for the week on their backs. The first four days of the race were just a wam-up for today.

programme.title: Xenta and Castoldi - Teamwork
programme.desc: Hop on board the Castoldi JT 34 Open Limo and discover a new way of handling your boat. The one you are about to see is equipped with a Castoldi waterjet engine, while the command is from Xenta. Accuracy and safety are guaranteed.

programme.title: Silent Yachts Shipyard - Factory Tour
programme.desc: Follow us walking through the factory of the Silent Yachts, where green and sustainable solutions were tested with particular attention to its impact to the environment at the sea.

programme.title: Camden Classic - 2023
programme.desc: Discover this year’s edition of The Camden Classics Cup, one of the world’s most beautiful regattas.

programme.title: Cigarette 41 Nighthawk - High performance and style

programme.title: Riviera Belize 66 Daybridge - Built for cruising

programme.title: Schaefer 660 - MIBS 2023
programme.desc: Bill Hackett is at the Miami International Boat Show on board Schaefer 660.

programme.title: Marex 360 CC - A Cruiser Cabriolet for Every Season

programme.title: Heesen Yachts – Palm Beach International Boat Show 2024
programme.desc: Maria Elisa Altese presents Book Ends, the 50 meter superyacht by Heesen Yachts. The strengths of this vessel include exceptional performance, magnificent design and the shipyards cutting-edge innovation for eco-sustainable advancement.

programme.title: Heesen Project Cosmos
programme.desc: The Boat Show brings you to The Netherlands for an exclusive experience. Discover Heesen Shipyard and its Project Cosmos, the superyacht Galactica, still under construction. It will measure 80.07 meters with a top speed of 29 knots, it is going to be the world’s largest and fastest full-aluminum motoryacht.

programme.title: Scanner Envy 1200 – Fulfilled dreams
programme.desc: The shipyard Scanner Marine has fulfilled the dream of those asking for a model such as this Scanner Envy 1200, and our Bacci Del Buono is in Varazze to test it out! Born from the creativity and craftsmanship of Donato Montemitro, this model is everything you were waiting for.

programme.title: Pearl 72 - Flibs 2022

programme.title: Tecnomar for Lamborghini 63 - Unmistakable style

programme.title: Nordhavn 51 Awanui – Fort Lauderdale International Boat Show

programme.title: Elegance and innovative solutions

programme.title: Eng 5 Residential Fire
programme.desc: Station 5, its the first morning of this 48 hour shift. They are all doing chores working on the yard. They had just finished up when the call came in; it sounds like a structure fire. As they are in route, it comes over the radio that neighbors are calling in, they see smoke. Engine 5 arrives on scene, the 1st In, and they pull a line, Mike is on the nozzle, and we go into the fire with Mike as he enters the garage, and its blazing. After the fire, they all re-hab, get their bottles filled while the Battalion Chief goes over the ops.

programme.title: Engines 3 and 9
programme.desc: We finish up a 24 hour shift with the crew from Engine 9 who finish with a morning structure fire. The next 24 hours back at Station 9 with firefighter Robert Castillion, he just made Captain at the busiest station in Fresno, Station 3. Garcia is the Engineer. A call comes in, its a rubbish fire. Its Night, we are back at Station 9, to find the crew in the engine bay doing todays exercise. Then, the call comes in, with both engine companies responding. Engine 3 is on-scene with Truck 4 when Engine 9 arrives. Tonight they are testing out some Key Combat Ready Hose line, it pulls out great; they are in on this mattress wherehouse fire for a little while.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 6
programme.desc: The US Military flexes its might with some of the strongest, most adaptable ground vehicles in the world. Serve and protect.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 7
programme.desc: Tanks and other wheeled beasts grind across every terrain imaginable during training exercises and while deployed in actual combat. Their versatility is undeniable as they hurtle across sand and snow with equal efficiency

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 8
programme.desc: Part one of a two-part exploration of the militarys mobile cities. Aircraft carriers function like massive well-oiled machines that expand the reach of the armed services.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 9
programme.desc: Part two of a two-part episode on aircraft carriers that shows the sailors and pilots performing the seemingly miraculous task of catching a jet moving at 150 mph on a ships deck thats only 300 ft. long.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 10
programme.desc: The most prolific large ship in the fleet, destroyers were originally built to protect larger ships, but their ability to take on anything that comes their way, from air or sea, makes them formidable opponents in their own right.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 11
programme.desc: The second-largest ships in the fleet, after aircraft carriers, cruisers function as mobile missile platforms, always on the lookout for enemy aircraft or incoming missiles.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 12
programme.desc: Stand on the deck and crouch through the holds of the vessels that have inspired countless movies. From the modern computer stations to the apparently timeless engine rooms, real-life submarines have just as many stories to tell.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 13
programme.desc: Exciting footage of submarines ripping through the waves and breaking through thick sheets of ice. Anywhere, in any season, the sailors operating these stealthy ships are always prepared for action.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 14
programme.desc: Whether theyre rolling, sailing, or standing in place, cannons employed by modern military forces are a far cry from the first gunpowder projectiles found in 12th century China.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 15
programme.desc: Rockets can take our space program to the next frontier or deliver an enemy target back to the stone ages. It takes a balance of science and courage to build and deploy these payload delivery systems, as well as their more sophisticated, guidance-controlled siblings, missiles.

programme.title: Justin Bieber - Live at Madison Square Garden
programme.desc: The film follows the pop star Justin Bieber during 10 days counting down to his performance at Madison Square Garden. It also includes footage from his My World Tour, interviews with family and friends, a visit to his original hometown in Canada, and some of the story and videos of his childhood.

programme.title: The Killers - Live at Rock Am Ring
programme.desc: Rock Am Ring (Nürburgring), Rock Im Park (Nuremberg) is a music festival that takes place annually at the Nürburgring Race Track in western Germany. Featuring The Killers.

programme.title: Primal Scream - Rock Legends
programme.desc: Primal Scream is a Scottish rock band originally formed in 1982 in Glasgow by Bobby Gillespie (vocals) and Jim Beattie. The lineup consists of Gillespie, Andrew Innes (guitar), Martin Duffy (keyboards), Simone Butler (bass) and Darrin Mooney (drums). Barrie Cadogan has toured and recorded with the band since 2006, as a replacement after the departure of guitarist Robert "Throb" Young.

programme.title: Paul Weller - Rock Legends
programme.desc: Starting out with the band The Jam (1976–82), Weller branched out to a more soulful style with The Style Council (1983–89), before establishing himself as a successful solo artist in 1991. He is also the principal figure of the 1970s and 1980s mod revival, and is often referred to as The Modfather.

programme.title: Roy Orbison - Rock Legends
programme.desc: Roy Orbison nicknamed the Big O, was an American singer-songwriter and musician, known for his distinctive, impassioned voice, complex compositions and dark emotional ballads. Leading music critics cast fresh light on the career of Roy Orbison.

programme.title: Chemin Pealey
programme.desc: Enjoy the view from rocky cliffs that overlook calm waters.

programme.title: Zen Moment
programme.desc: Head to Newfoundland’s Amherst Cove to admire the quiet and glacial beauty of icebergs drifting across the bay.

programme.title: Best of Inspiring Forest Trail
programme.desc: A unique spot in the heart of the Laurentians: gaze over the peaceful lake as its smooth waves gently crawl to the shore.

programme.title: Tiny house by the coast: Îles de la Madeleine
programme.desc: A lone house looks over the gentle waters of a rocky coast.

programme.title: Awe Of Nature
programme.desc: Follow the Yukon River as it snakes a path through the evergreen wilderness.

programme.title: Herbert Blomstedt & Lucerne Festival Orchestra - Beethoven - Symphony No. 3 in E-flat major, Op. 55
programme.desc: Maestro Herbert Blomstedt makes his debut with the Lucerne Festival Orchestra at 2020’s Lucerne Festival conducting Ludwig van Beethoven’s celebrated Symphony No. 3 in E-flat major, Op. 55, “Eroica”. The sprightly Swedish conductor celebrated his 93rd birthday just one month before this performance. This remarkable performance was recorded at the Lucerne Culture and Congress Center (KKL), Switzerland, in August 2020.

programme.title: Théophile Alexandre - Classica Spotlight
programme.desc: Cinematic classical clips and energizing concert pieces featuring up-and-coming artists.

programme.title: Leonard Slatkin, Orchestre National de Lyon, Olga Kern & Sol Gabetta - Slatkin conducts Bolcom, Beethoven & Ravel
programme.desc: American conductor Leonard Slatkin leads the Orchestre National de Lyon in a concert recorded at the Auditorium de Lyon in 2014. The concert opens with William Bolcom´s Circus Ouverture, which was specially composed for Slatkin's 70th birthday. The concert continues with a performance of Beethoven's Triple Concerto in C, Op. 56 performed by three female soloists: Olga Kern (piano), Baibe Skride (violin) and Sol Gabetta (cello). The work is the only concerto which Beethoven ever completed for more than one solo instrument. The concert closes with Ravel's beloved orchestration of Mussorgsky's Pictures at an Exhibition.

programme.title: Seong-Jin Cho - Classica Spotlight
programme.desc: Cinematic classical clips and energizing concert pieces featuring up-and-coming artists.

programme.title: Pavel Milyukov & Boris Berezovsky - Works for violin by Franck, Fauré, Schubert a.o.
programme.desc: Russian violinist Pavel Milyukov and pianist Boris Berezovsky join forces in this concert recorded at Tchaikovsky Concert Hall in Moscow, Russia, on October 15, 2020. Milyukov has won prizes at various international competitions and has appeared at venues throughout Europe. He forms an excellent chamber music duo with acclaimed pianist Boris Berezovsky. On this concert’s program are César Franck’s Sonata for violin and piano; Gabriel Fauré’s Après un rêve; Alfred Schnittke’s Stille Nacht; and Franz Schubert’s Erlkönig. As an encore, the duo performs ‘Russian Song’ from Igor Stravinsky’s opera Mavra (arranged by S. Dushkin).

programme.title: Daniel Barenboim - Classica Spotlight
programme.desc: Cinematic classical clips and energizing concert pieces featuring up-and-coming artists.

programme.title: Leonardo García Alarcón, Cappella Mediterranea & Mariana Flores - Vocal baroque works by Cavalli, Strozzi & Bembo
programme.desc: Argentinian conductor and harpsichordist Leonardo García Alarcón leads his ensemble Cappella Mediterranea in a program of Italian Baroque music. The ensemble performs some of the finest Baroque pieces composed by Francesco Cavalli, a prominent composer in 17th-century Venice, and two of his famous students, Barbara Strozzi and Antonia Bembo. Argentinian soprano Mariana Flores presents the vocal works. On the program are ‘Mira questi due lumi’ from Cavalli’s Le nozze di Teti e di Peleo, ‘Dimmi, Amor, che farò’ from L'Oristeo, ‘Sinfonia della notte’ from L’Egisto, and ‘E vuol dunque Ciprigna’ from Ercole Amante; ‘M’ingannasti in verità’ from Bembo’s Produzioni armoniche consacrate a Luigi XIV; Strozzi’s Sino alla morte, Che si può fare, Lagrime mie, L’amante segreto, and è Pazzo il moi core; Biagio Marini’s La Romanesca; Tarquinio Merula’s Aria Sopra La Cieccona; and Dario Castello’s Sonata Seconda. This performance was recorded at the magnificent Église Notre-Dame of Sablé-sur-Sarthe, France, on August 26, 2020.

programme.title: Steve Gadd - Chick Corea and Friends
programme.desc: Many of pianist Chick Corea’s compositions have become jazz standards. As a member of Miles Davis' band in the late 1960s, he participated in the birth of the electric jazz fusion movement. In the 1970s, Corea founded the legendary jazz fusion group Return to Forever. Along with Herbie Hancock, McCoy Tyner and Keith Jarrett, Corea is one of the biggest modern jazz pianists. He continued musical collaborations with a diverse range of artists, exploring various musical styles. This broadcast features three performances that illustrate Chick Corea's many talents.

programme.title: Cannonball Adderley - DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Chucho Valdés, Concha Buika, Rodney Barreto & Dreiser Durruthy Bombale - Chucho Valdes - Jazz a Vienne
programme.desc: ‘Jazz a Vienne’ is one of the world's most prestigious jazz festivals. Ever since 1981 it has attracted leading jazz artists, with many of them playing return engagements. Unsurprisingly, the festival's 2013 edition did not fall short of expectations: the lineup was filled with the biggest names in music. Among them were Chucho Valdes and his Afro-Cuban Messengers, the prime example of Latin-inspired jazz music. Together with vocalists Concha Buika and Dreiser Durruthy Bombale, Rodney Barreto on drums, Gaston Joya on double bass, Yaroldy Abreu Robles on congas, and Reinaldo Melian Alvarez on trumpet, the legendary pianist brings the streets of Havana to the festival’s stage.

programme.title: Billie Holiday - Fine and Mellow
programme.desc: “God Bless The Child”, “Foolin’ Myself”, and “I Loves You, Porgy”: timeless songs that were made classics by the inimitable Billie Holiday. ‘Lady Day’, as her loyal friend and musical partner Lester Young nicknamed her, was a highly original jazz and pop singer. In a career that spanned most of the 1930s, 1940s and 1950s, she displayed an uncanny ability to convey emotion through her voice. Her vocals, which were strongly inspired by instrumental jazz, are admired for their deeply personal and intimate sound. This compilation features recordings from the 1950s of Billie Holiday singing a string of her greatest successes. Enjoy this unique footage of one of jazz’s all-time greats!

programme.title: Clark Terry - The Skymasters with Clark Terry - North Sea Jazz
programme.desc: The North Sea Jazz Festival is the largest indoor music festival in the world, known globally as the event where the past, present and future of jazz are featured within three days. Next to a firm base of jazz as the festival’s staple music genre, many others, such as blues, soul, funk, or hip hop, pass by. In 1989, Dutch big band and radio orchestra The Skymasters took flight at the North Sea Jazz Festival in the Hague. Joining them is jazz legend Clark Terry on trumpet, flugelhorn and vocals in this exciting collaboration.

programme.title: Chet Baker - I Wouldn't Give a Cripple Crab a Crutch
programme.desc: This selection of unforgettable performances by some of the most iconic and influential male jazz and pop vocalists in history showcases these legends’ unique essence. Delight in the expressive beauty and emotional depth of Chet Baker's rendition of “Time After Time” and “You Don't Know What Love Is", recorded live in Brussels, Belgium in 1964 and in Rome, Italy in 1956 respectively. Revel in Frank Sinatra's iconic version of “I've Got You Under My Skin". Immerse yourself in Dizzy Gillespie's dynamic performance of “Let Me Outta Here”, recorded live in Denmark in 1970. Enjoy Tony Bennett's unforgettable performance of “It Don't Mean A Thing (If It Ain't Got That Swing)” at London’s majestic Royal Albert Hall in 1974. Let the haunting beauty of Nat King Cole's 1957 performance of “Autumn Leaves” and Louis Armstrong's performance of “Basin Street Blues” from 1959 delight you. Dean Martin’s smooth vocal stylings will enthrall you as he performs the jazz standard “Wrap Your Troubles In Dreams". Witness the electrifying energy of Sammy Davis Jr.'s performance of “Too Close For Comfort”. Join us for this unforgettable musical experience that you'll surely cherish!

programme.title: Kurt Rosenwinkel, Tim Motzer & Gintas Janusonis - Kurt Rosenwinkel - Bandit 65
programme.desc: Jazzfest Bonn is an annual festival of modern and creative jazz music. Every May it presents local and international jazz musicians in concert halls all over the German city. Among the artists of the 2017 edition is Bandit 65, a trio of breathtaking virtuosity, great power, boundless breadth, and astounding beauty. Together with Tim Motzer on guitar and electronics, and Gintas Janusonis on drums and percussion, guitarist and band leader Kurt Rosenwinkel explores the intersection of guitars, rhythm, electronics, soundscapes, free improvisation, and telepathic interplay.

programme.title: The Watch List
programme.desc: The Watch List with Nicole Petallides offers investors a midday look at the most relevant stocks, sectors and commodities. Petallides hosts a panel of experts ranging from industry-leading CEOs, analysts and Wall Street influencers to discuss pressing topics moving the market in real-time. The Watch List provides viewers with a midpoint status update for the end of the trading day and beyond.

programme.title: Market On Close

The show is a conversation looking at what is driving headlines globally, and what these trends mean for markets, the economy, and your financial future. What are the stories that will impact your portfolio for the next year, next decade and beyond? Tune in to Market Overtime to get a new perspective on investing.

Also watch as David Babakhanyan takes on Daniel Gualajara and in the main event, Elwig Wassmer, defending title holder and a biochemist looks to take on Israel Lua (Ben Jones camp) with knockout power, in whats expected to be a combustible fight with two titles on the line. programme.title: UFA 360-362 - KOK 104 World Series Kaunas

Also watch Bruno Borges from Portugal take on Lithuanian Samuelis Sorochovas. United Fight Alliance presents King of Kings 104 World Series Kaunas, Lithuania part 2. United Fight Alliance presents King of Kings 104 World Series Kaunas, Lithuania part 3. First up Moldovanian Nicolai Garbuz faces Mantas Kondratavicius of Lithuania in an MMA Bushido bout and Sasa Polugic takes on Mantas Rimdeika for some heavyweight action. In the main event Simon Santana and Matas Pultarazinskas head to the ring for a featherweight bout with the World Championship up for grabs.

programme.title: Taipei
programme.desc: Being underestimated, is one of the biggest advantages. Maybe that’s what makes Taipei a unique city and one of Asia’s best kept secrets when it comes to food, fun, and all things lifestyle. Often under-reported and overlooked, Taiwan’s global impact for such a small island is breathtaking. When it comes to Taiwan and food, experts and enthusiasts alike know that they go hand-in-hand. It is no wonder Taipei is overflowing with electricity as new ideas and re-imagined classics are popping up all over town. This magical friction is a big reason Taipei’s food scene is attracting young talent from the world’s best kitchens looking to experiment, innovate, and test their ideas against the discerning palates of the local crowds. Highlighted by some of the world’s best produce, great transportation, magnificent hiking trails 5 minutes from downtown, a vibrant nightlife, and an openness towards travelers and new faces makes Taipei one of Black Buddha’s favorite cities.

programme.title: Dubai acts to stem the tide of single use plastic
programme.desc: Dubai’s airports have banned all single use plastics as the city works towards a plastic-free future. It comes as the attitude towards single use plastics is changing. In Dubai, 90 per cent of people say they are making a conscious effort to reduce their own plastic waste consumption. Nearly four in five say they recycle more now than they did five years ago. And one in four people say theyre encouraged to recycle more by corporations championing plastic-free initiatives. Dubai International Airport along with Dubai World Central welcome almost 90 million passengers each year. But with those passengers comes 5,500 tonnes of plastic. The airports’ operator, Dubai Airports, banned all single use plastics from inside the terminal at the beginning of this year. That means that plastic cutlery, water bottles, drinking straws, packaging and polythene bags are all banned from cafes and restaurants. Eugene Barry, Dubai Airports’ executive vice president (commercial), told Focus: “Ninety five per cent of our partners have actually made the pledge to switch from plastic to appropriate and relevant substitutes for some of the products that are used in catering and retail across the airport.” The operator hopes its a strategy that might become a template for other major transportation hubs and businesses. “This is very much the early stages of a long journey, I believe, to have a more environmentally friendly approach to managing businesses,” Barry said. Dubai’s 700 hotels are already looking at alternatives, such as switching water bottles from plastic to glass. Plastic key cards could also be a thing of the past, as developers look into switching them to wood-based materials. The eco packaging company Avani is one firm offering plastic-free alternatives, including a bag made from cassava, a cheap and common root vegetable. The material is biodegradable and compostable, breaking down over a period of months on land or at sea. Peter Avram, managing director of Avani Middle East, said: “Until a c

programme.title: "Veganity": World's largest vegan restaurant opened in Dubai
programme.desc: There is an undeniable trend towards a plant-based diet. In the UK, the number of vegans reportedly quadrupled between 2014 and 2018. Even fast-food giants are now offering vegan alternatives to meat. And here in Dubai, a restaurant billed as the worlds largest vegan restaurant (‘Veganity’) has just opened its doors. Veganity’s founder Sky Sommer’s business was borne of her desire to show people that having a plant-based diet does not have to be a sacrifice. With over 200 dishes on the menu, everything from soul food to gourmet food are on offer. Sommer’s favourite dish is Molokhia; a recipe which has its roots in Ancient Egypt. “Its actually the name of a leaf; a greeny leaf that looks like spinach. So you just put olive oil, onions and garlic and coriander. This is what gives it that kick. Tomato paste, white vinegar, vegetable stock. Once you add the molokhia and the tomato paste you just let it boil to render down a bit. It becomes a bit thick and then you just get a hand blender.” Below weve provided a delicious Vegan recipe for you to try at home. Recipe Laham Ajeen Chop tomatoes x4 Diced onions x2 Garlic diced x8 Parsley chopped x1 bunch Red capsicum small squares x1 Green capsicum small squares x1 Minced meat (TVP) 250g Cook all together with 3-4 tablespoons of olive oil for around 10 minutes then add the spices below until they are well combined: Paprika x 4 tablespoons 7 spices x 4 tablespoons Garlic powder x 2 tablespoons Vegan Worcester sauce x 1 tablespoons Tomato paste x 4 tablespoons Vegetable stock x 1 cup Leave to marinate for up to 1 hour stirring it every 15 min till all liquids have dissolved then serve with half a lemon slice. The dough 5 cups of flour of choice 2 cups water Pinch of salt Sieve the flour into a bowl Add the salt Slowly add the water bit by bit while mixing the dough, cover and let rest for 30 minutes in a cool place then roll out to a clean surface and need for 5 min. Then cut the dough into 3 inch balls and roll the do

programme.title: La Mer: Dubai's bohemian beachfront
programme.desc: Postcards heads down to La Mer, Dubais newest beachfront development to check out the vintage-style beach huts, water sports, restaurants, bars, fashion stores and street art. A magnet for Instagrammers, La Mer is one of Dubai’s most colourful seaside destinations. The street art here talks to its audience. Visitors can hire a sunbed or rent a whole day room on the sand, and the multi-coloured beach huts house showers. And, if you fancy an ice cream, youll find some interesting flavours. "Here at iScream , we’re very crazy; thats why we have crazy flavours like curry, kulfi, ketchup, Mexican chilli-chocolate and you name it," says iSreams Managing Partner, Rami Halawi. ​At the confluence of north and south La Mer, you’ll find Laguna Water Park . Here you can test your courage on slides knotted with surprise twists and turns, or learn to surf on the 180-degree wave machine by Flowrider. For more wet and wild adventures, head to the beach – there are two water sports centres with a huge range of activities. Its also possible to explore the coast on a guided jet ski tour. Those who prefer airborne adventures can bounce around at Hawa Hawa , the weird and wavy trampoline-like playground imported from Japan. For those who just want to relax and chill out, dont worry, theres still plenty to do. Before day slips into night, secure a seat with sunset views at one of La Mer’s beautiful beachfront eateries. Masti is known for its mixology and its modern Indian cuisine. ​ If thats not enough, La Mer has a vintage-style cinema, fabulous street performers and seasonal celebrations to keep visitors entertained all night long. ​

programme.title: What to do in Pompano Beach
programme.desc: One of South Florida’s hidden gems is Pompano Beach, Florida. Located just north of Fort Lauderdale, this quiet beach town is perfect for those who prefer less crowds and a laid back atmosphere. It’s ideal location makes access to other South Florida towns, including Miami, super easy. I start my journey at the Fort Lauderdale Marriott Pompano Beach Resort & Spa. It has the most amazing sunrises which I delighted in each day from my private balcony. The hotel is located directly on the beach which makes it very difficult to leave. I visit the charming beachside town of Lauderdale by the Sea, a 10 minute drive from my hotel. I also take a tour at Butterfly World, the first and largest butterfly house in the United States. It is home over 80 species of butterflies, hummingbird and lorikeet aviaries, and outdoor gardens. This place is truly magical for people of all ages. Pompano Beach is the quintessential beach town. You can truly relax and enjoy the beach at your own pace while indulging as much or as little as you’d like.

programme.title: Taste Dubai: An Emirati Iftar
programme.desc: During Ramadan, practising Muslims abstain from eating and drinking during daylight hours. The meal that follows is known as Iftar, and you do not have to be Muslim to partake in one. In this edition of Taste, Euronews visited the Jumeirah Zabeel Saray Hotel in Dubai, to sample the special Iftar menu produced by the worlds first Emirati chef. After Athan, the call for evening prayer, Muslims who have been fasting all day can finally eat and drink. The fast is broken by first eating dates. This is of great religious significance, chef Musabbeh Al Kaabi explained. "Prophet Mohammed used to do this when he was breaking his fast, so we always break it with the dates then laban (a fermented milk drink) or water," he said. Chef Musabbeh first served up a traditional dish - king rice. Its name comes from its historically prestigious status as an expensive dish only eaten by royalty or the rich. "Liver is there, beef is there, saffron rice is there. So it’s all luxury things. I have cooked saffron rice, I have fried cauliflower, boiled chickpeas. Now I need to take the flavour of the onions with all these things," Chef Musabbeh said as he prepared the dish. "I will put the rice in now. I’ll put some spices in as well. So now, I’m going to put it on a plate, and I’m going to garnish it" But, before eating, everyone said Bismillā, which means in the name of Allah. Chef Musabbeh then prepared his second dish the famous Emirati ouzi with oriental rice, a lamb dish with cinnamon and cardamom. You can make the dish yourself by following the recipe below: Chef Musabbehs Ouzi and Oriental Rice Recipe Ingredients: 1100g lamb shank 500g of basmati rice 100g of minced lamb 2 bay leaves 3 cinnamon sticks 10g of garlic - freshly chopped 120g of onion - freshly chopped 100g of tomato - freshly chopped 20g of ghee butter Salt and pepper 6.5ml of water 10g of tamarind powder 40g of Emirati spices 30g of tomato paste 40g of coriander - freshly chopped Instructions: 1. Chop the onions, garli

programme.title: Fun Stuff to do in Brooklyn

programme.title: Kanda
programme.desc: One way to think about Kanda is to picture early Brooklyn, before the hipsters completely took over. It’s a place that perfectly embodies old and new Tokyo, a university town that attracts more than students. It’s a great place to live (some even think it’s one of the best kept secrets of Tokyo) with just about everything you need in one place — restaurants, nightlife, shopping, and easy access to just about any other part of the city. While tall gleaming skyscrapers haven’t taken over the landscape like much of Tokyo, there’s a good balance of historical and contemporary architecture to keep things interesting.Walk around and you’ll find neighborhood pockets that focusing on one thing: an entire street of used bookstores, another with stores and stores hawking vintage and new guitars; a three-story mecca for old-school arcade games; an entire block for ski and snowboarding gear. You can find Michelin-starred restaurants, gyoza specialists, internationally known ramen shops, and even great burger joints around the corner from each other. With friendly and fiercely proud locals who want to share the area’s history, from origami to the Kanda Myojin Shrine, this is a quieter part of Tokyo just waiting to be discovered.

programme.title: Top Ten Things to do in Puerto Rico
programme.desc: Number 10: Go for a hike in El Yunque National park – This is the only subtropical rainforest in the US (besides Hawaii) and is filled with so much bio diversity. Make sure you spot the ylang ylang tree to smell the beautiful flowers used in some of the best perfumes. http://ecotourspuertorico.com/el-yunque-tours-rainforest/ Number 9: Have lunch in La Placita at Chef Jose Enrique’s restaurant. Jose Enrique is an award winning chef who uses his master culinary skills to enrich traditional Puerto Rican dishes. http://www.joseenriquepr.com/ Number 8: Shop in el Mercado in La Placita – Be sure to stop by and talk to Hector Ruiz Housler, who sells herbs and concoctions used to treat all sorts of ailments. Number 7: Have a cafecito at Café Cuatro Sombras - Located in Old San Juan and has the richest, most authentic Puerto Rican coffee in town. http://cuatrosombras.com/ Number 6: Visit Casa Cortés - Indulge your senses in fine chocolate and fine art here. Try their chocolate and cheese snack and sample one of their delicious chocolate beverages. http://www.casacortespr.com/ Number 5: Go to Piñones for authentic Puerto Rican street food – Try the fresh oysters, clams and all of the delicious fried food offered here. Be sure to pass by the cultural center to learn the history of this important Puerto Rican neighborhood. Number 4: Spend an afternoon in the Botanical Gardens – Take a tour and smell the cinnamon and bay rum trees and if you’re lucky, you just might spot a coqui. http://sanjuanpuertorico.com/san-juan-botanical-garden-jardin-botanico-universidad-de-puerto-rico/ Number 3: Stay on Condado Beach. I love the San Juan Marriott Resort and Casino. It’s a quick drive from the airport, has breathtaking views, and has amazing service. http://www.marriott.com/hotels/travel/sjupr-san-juan-marriott-resort-and-stellaris-casino/ Number 2: Have a Bioluminescence experience - Puerto Rico has three Bioluminescent bays which contain millions of micro-organisms, called “dinoflagellates”, that glow fluorescent in the dark when agi

programme.title: Tour of quirky Anna Maria Island, Florida
programme.desc: Take a video tour of Anna Maria Island, Florida, where chain restaurants and hotels are nearly impossible to find. Instead this Gulf of Mexico island thrives on a mix of California earthiness and Florida quirkiness.

programme.title: Liya Wang
programme.desc: The Story of Liya WangThe “Black Pearl” of Taiwan, supermodel Liya Wang, was nicknamed thus due to her dark, tanned complexion; she perfectly embodies the strong, empowered women at the forefront of the fitness movement today. Looking at her million-watt smile now, little would one have guessed that Liya also went through a dark period in her life. When she won the ELLE Model Look competition back in 2005, at the very height of her career, she bid farewell to the life of glitz and glamour and moved to Shanghai to live a quiet life of marital bliss with her then-newly-wed husband, Lin Yongchao. Just two years into the marriage, the once happy couple divorced and went their separate ways. The period that followed was a downward spiral that Liya finds hard to look back upon even now. Yet, like a phoenix rising from the ashes, she found a new burning passion that reawakened her zest for life - her love of fitness and exercise.Today, Liya has taken time out of her day to tell us her story and recent endeavors. With smooth, sun-kissed skin and minimal make up, Liya flashes us her pearly-whites that remind us of the famous Disney character, Pocahontas. Growing up, becoming a model never crossed Liya’s mind. She perceived her tanned skin and naturally curly hair as against the norm of what was considered aesthetically beautiful, and was naturally surprised when she was approached by a stylist while strolling in Ximending, one of Taipei’s popular shopping districts. The stylist asked her to go in for a casting at Eelin, the model management company in which she is currently still signed to today. As it was Summer break and she had little to do, Liya decided to go to the casting with little expectations, and thus unwittingly began her fifteen-year-long career.It wasn’t all smooth sailing from there, especially the first couple of years into the modelling business. Liya found herself trying to be someone else, fitting into the mold of the successful models before her, afraid to stand out and be herself. Her skin tone, her h

programme.title: Mrs. Pound
programme.desc: Dont judge a book by its cover, this is not your average stamp shop. Inspired by a fictional story of secret lovers, Mrs. Pound brings to life the story of a former 1950s Shanghai burlesque dancer, her married lover (Mr. Ming) and their elaborate clandestine rendezvous space. Offering a new twist on asian fusion cuisine, the 45 seat venue features a lower dining room (Mrs. Pound), an upper dining room (Mr . Ming), and a bar area at which these two spaces merge. Mixed with plush velvet banquettes, vintage tiles, neon artwork, suspended mirrored marquee lights with lipstick messages, and a 1960s style showgirl glamour, Mrs. Pounds creative interior sets the tone for a unique and entertaining culinary (and drinking) experience. We like the Hainanese Chicken Rice, Thai Milk Tea Cake, Sriracha Street Corn, and Lemongrass Pork Chop. Although it will be a longer wait, do yourself a favor and go for dinner for the best experience.

programme.title: Jilsiru Tteok Cafe
programme.desc: At first blush, the Jilsiru Tteok Cafe may strike more adventurous explorers as a bit of a snoozefest. Its a cafe attached to an actual Tteok museum (koreans take their rice cakes seriously) inside the old, traditional Insadong neighborhood. Nothing new or trendy but its actually one of those places that you may find yourself wandering back into after your initial bad attitude. The first floor houses the Tteok Cafe where one can essentially purchase and eat every variety of Tteok known to mankind pretty much. The textures and fillings are as varied as the many colors that are on display and its easy to mindlessly go into a tteok-frenzy but it pays to be selective because theres only so much glutinous rice hunks one can eat in one sitting and tteok is known to go stale quickly.When youve had your fill of colorful starch, head up to the 2nd floor where you can find the museum part of the experience and learn about the thousands of years of tteok history. And if youre wanting a little more action after, head on over to the traditional Korean Liquor Museum which is in the same building.In total, this place really is a hub for Koreas days of yore, including spreads on North Korean cuisine and what emperors have been served . Just make sure you come brave enough to try the dried manta ray.

programme.title: Top Ten Things to do in St. Maarten
programme.desc: Here are my top 10 things to do in St. Maarten plus the details on how to do them.... 1. Taste local Rum - Visit Toppers Rhum Factory. www.toppersrhum.com/ 2. Visit Nectar of St. Maarten for natural / organic skin care, protection and bug repellent. These products are sold throughout the islands and are amazing!! 3. Party - Come during Carnival and experience Jouvert and party with the locals. 4. Go shopping at the Marigot Market on the French side 8. Visit Loterie Farm in the hills of Pic Paradis to be surrounded by nature as you zipline, party or relax by the pool. http://loteriefarm.com/ 9. Visit Orient Beach - Its on the French side and is the most popular beach on the island. It is also home to Club Orient which is a clothing optional beach resort. 10. Watch the extreme airport landings from Maho Beach. Schedule some time before your flight home to experience this.

programme.title: The biodiversity of Dubai's shores has brought fly fishing to the Middle East for the first time
programme.desc: When most people think of fly fishing they think of being far out in the wilderness, away from civilisation, by a river or somewhere in the ocean. But Ocean Active Fly has re-imagined this scene - offering urban fly fishing right in the middle of Dubai. This is the first fly fishing operation in the Middle East. The founder, Nick Bowles, explained to Euronews why fishing there are fishing opportunities in Dubai: "Dubai’s built the biggest man-made reefs with the palm islands and that, so it’s created a huge habitat." Artificial reefs can lead to a quick increase in the local fish population. They draw plankton which smaller fish can prey on which then attracts bigger fish suitable for fly fishing. One species drawn to the artificial reefs in Dubai is the queenfish. They can grow to be over a metre long and up to 15 kilograms, although most are about half that weight. This kind of fish is particularly good for fly fishing because of its visual takes and the fact it swims in schools. Fly fishing differs from more conventional spin fishing. Instead of having a heavy lure at the end of the fishing line, fly fishers have a fly which is lighter and less likely to scare away game. The fly stays on the surface of the water where fish will be attracted to it, thinking it is prey. With ocean fly fishing youre constantly on the move to find the next school of fish "So you literally run - shoot, run - shoot." But the unique part of fly fishing in Dubai is the proximity to its skyline. Fly fishing is done close to the shore so anglers are surrounded by the citys landmarks.: the Burj Khalifa, the Burj Al Arab, Palm Jumeirah and Dubai Marina.

programme.title: The Story of the Zhonghe Animal Shelter
programme.desc: The Story of the Zhonghe Animal Shelter In Taiwan, the issue of homeless animals has been a cause for concern for many years, and even in the capital city of Taipei, stray dogs and cats are a common sight. Taiwan saw a rise in abandoned animals during the 1980’s, during a time of economic growth. Residents who were uninformed of the responsibilities that comes with raising a pet, eventually abandoned said animals on the streets. Today, we have invited Godfrey Gao, a Taiwanese-Canadian actor, model and humanitarian, to interview the Director of the Animal Epidemic Prevention Center. The setting is at the Zhonghe Animal Shelter, a place that has truly become a haven for stray dogs in recent years.Operating under the government of New Taipei City, Zhonghe Animal Shelter seeks to provide unwanted dogs with the safest and best care they can afford. Upon entering their care, every animal will be given vaccination, a health screening, de-worming, microchip implantation, and are spayed or neutered. Depending on their gender, male dogs will receive a mark on the left ear, while females are marked on the right ear. Once the process is finished, these dogs are ready for adoption.While there are other breeds at the animal shelter, their stay is never long since they get adopted rather swiftly, leaving the shelter with a 90 majority of the Formosan Mountain Dog, or more simply known as, Taiwanese Dog. The characteristics of the Taiwanese dog breed include a triangular face, agile feet that are known for their hopping skill, and a sickle tail. The personality of the Formosan is loyal, intelligent, affectionate and understanding. “These dogs are suited for being hunting or search dogs, so the current feeding rate for these dogs is quite high. We mainly have black ones, but we also have brown and yellow ones,” says the Director.Currently, most, if not all the dogs at the Shelter have been desexed. This ‘zero-kill’ plan started on the 1st of March last year, under the guidance of the mayor of New Taipei City, Zhu Li Luen. Howeve

programme.title: Did you know Dubai is fifth most instagrammed city in the world?
programme.desc: Dubai has been named the 5th most Instagrammed city in the world in a survey by travel site Wego. From its sweeping beaches, to standout architecture and world class restaurants, there’s a photo opportunity to be found at every landmark and for every occasion. In fact, food is one of the main reasons for visiting the city. Dubai led the way in the food category for Instagram hashtags with a massive 26 per cent of all hashtags in or including Dubai also including food. This summer alone there were 79 million hashtags related to Dubai. Some of the hotspots include the city’s Miracle Garden which is the largest flower garden in the world. It has 72,000 square metres with over 50 million blooming flowers. As well as the Miracle Garden, downtown Dubai is also home to the Burj Khalifa which is also one of the top five most instagrammed places in the city. And in the city’s centrally located Zabeel Park you can find Dubai Frame, an architectural landmark. This 150-metre-high, 93-metre-wide structure is positioned so that visitors can soak in the views of modern Dubai to the south and old Dubai to the north. Mamoun Hmedan, Managing Director, MENA and India, Wego says the ranking is a huge achievement for Dubai. “Dubai is the one and only Arab city that’s ranked within the top five. That’s a lot for one city compared to very well-established tourism destinations,” he says. The top city in terms of hashtags was London with 118 million posts. Next was Paris with 101 million, followed by Nice and New York who received 87 million and 83 million respectively. Other top hashtags include Istanbul, Jakarta, Los Angeles, Barcelona, Moscow, and Tokyo. Sarah Hedley Hymers is a travel journalist and social media influencer. She says putting photos on Instagram is all about social capital. “You want to present something that is aspirational," she explains. "It has to be well-framed. It has to be colourful – dark pictures don’t do so well on Instagram. So, you’re looking for something that is bright, that real

programme.title: Love and Money – How Finances Can Influence Your Relationships
programme.desc: Establishing and maintaining healthy relationships is already challenging on its own—but it becomes even more critical when money is involved. Be ready for a no-holds-barred discussion of the emotions and dollar-and-sense knowledge that comes into play when becoming financially intimate in relationships and leave with practical tips, skills, and strategies to protect yourself—both emotionally and financially, and be all the richer for it.

programme.title: Conversations that Count: The Myth of the Black Superwoman
programme.desc: In American culture, most of us are overworked and overwhelmed, especially women. Black women carry extra pressure to overachieve and outperform. Freda Lewis-Hall, Senior Medical Advisor and Former Chief Patient Officer at Pfizer, sits down with Phylicia Rashad, our 2017 Legacy Award Honoree and Award-winning Actress, to explore real-life, practical suggestions on how black women can take better care of themselves and uplift each other as sisters.

programme.title: Spike Lee Defends His Movie 'Chi-Raq'
programme.desc: Award-winning filmmaker and director Spike Lee, talks about his latest, and some say, controversial film, "Chi-Raq." Then, we hit the red carpet with two members of the cast of The Color Purple: Jennifer Hudson and Cynthia Ervio. They share their journey to the stage in one of the latest musicals to hit Broadway. And finally, we talk with superstar music producer, Swizz Beatz, who recently celebrated a milestone with 300 million albums sold. Now, hes developed a new passion for the visual arts as a collector and curator.

programme.title: Improve Your Relationship With Yourself

programme.title: Sticking To Financial Goals Despite The Threat of Recession
programme.desc: It seems that every economic expert is forecasting a recession in 2023, sparking anxiety that often leads poor financial choices. Kara Stevens, founder of The Frugal Feminista and author of the new book Heal Your Relationship With Money, joins Your Money Your Life to help us move past our fears in order to focus on adjustments we can make now to prepare for a recession, while remaining committed to our financial goals.

programme.title: The Team House | Former Senior CIA Operations Officer Ed Bogan
programme.desc: Ed is a retired CIA Operations Officer with 24 years of experience in national security and intelligence operations in South Asia, the Middle East, Africa, and Europe. He is a two time Chief of Station (COS) and three time Chief of Base (COB). Bogan served five of his seven PCS assignments in three designated war/combat zones, as well as Acting positions in countries in armed conflict.

programme.title: Breaking Bread with Brooke Burke - Special Guest Carnie Wilson

programme.title: Breaking Bread with Brooke Burke - Special Guests Nicole Ari Parker and Boris Kodjoe

programme.title: Breaking Bread with Brooke Burke - Special Guests Ali Landry and Alejandro Gomez Monteverde

programme.title: Ben Fogle: Starting Up Starting Over - Episode 1
programme.desc: In 2016, newlyweds Jade and Alice (aged 34 and 26 at the time) decide to turn their backs on successful careers in London to relocate 500 miles north to the stunning Scottish Highlands. They plough the proceeds from selling their flat in Croydon and all their savings into buying and restoring a 200 year old rundown and remote small hotel, in order to start new lives being their own boss as hoteliers and restaurateurs.

programme.title: Ben Fogle: Starting Up Starting Over - Episode 2
programme.desc: Ben Fogle travels to the small town of Ulverston in the beautiful Cumbrian countryside beside the Lake District to meet Kat and Gwill and explore their dream of owning and running their own café-restaurant. Kat left a high-powered legal career in the City of London, trading her flat by the Thames for a 300 year old warehouse in Ulverston which she wants to convert into a café-pizzeria.

programme.title: Hawaii, A Journey Through The Big Island

programme.title: Arches & Canyonlands Ambient Nature Film

The spectacular cinematography is accompanied by beautiful Native American flute music. Note: All Drone footage was filmed outside of National and State Park boundaries.

programme.title: Death Valley & Mono Lake - New Extended Version!
programme.desc: Experience the dramatic beauty of Death Valley, from sunrise over the sand dunes to the colorful formations of Zabriske point. Explore the unique limestone formations known as "tufa towers", the amazing bird life, and relaxing serenity of Mono Lake, an inland sea at the base of the Sierra Mountains. Bonus footage of the geothermal "hot creek" in the Sierras. This film is newly extended with awe-inspiring footage of the nesting Ospreys and aerial views of Mono Lake!

programme.title: The Power of Words
programme.desc: Busy dad gets wake up call from business associates Mohammed Qahtani and Ian Humphrey sharing true stories about fatherhood and how promises are meant to be kept.

programme.title: EPIC MOTIVATIONAL Top Speeches VOL 3
programme.desc: Trapped in a 9-5 job that you hate? Stuck in debt? If you feel stuck and feel like you’re living a life with no purpose, this video is for you. Hear from motivational moguls Joe Rogan, Robert Downey Jr., Will Smith, Gary Vee and more as they help you to realize your own dreams and break free from the matrix.

programme.title: Top EPIC MOTIVATIONAL Speeches Vol. 1
programme.desc: Here is Goalcasts collection of the top motivational speeches to get you pumped.

programme.title: The Rise Of Damien Rider
programme.desc: S1:E7 Damien Rider was beaten up, thrown against walls, and left all by himself as a child because of an abusive stepfather. After four attempts to end his own life, he decided he needed to deal with his demons by doing the most extreme thing he could do. Discover why Damien felt like he needed to paddle through a deadly ocean and why when he was just about to quit, the entire trajectory of his life would be permanently changed forever.

programme.title: The Rise of Charity Witt
programme.desc: S1:E5 Dubbed The Worlds Strongest Barbie, Charity suffered a heart attack when she was only 17 years old, due to being overworked and poor life choices. This health crisis lead her to change her mindset by taking action on changing her life, that put her on a path that lead her to becoming an elite powerlifter, a Strongwoman competitor, a winner of the Titan Games and escaping an abusive relationship.

programme.title: The Rise of Jonny Kim
programme.desc: S1:E3 From the outside, Jonny Kim looks like one of the most ambitious people you’ll ever hear about. A person who can become a Navy SEAL, a doctor and an astronaut all before the age of 40 must be a confident, talented person. However, Jonny didn’t grow up aspiring to be a highly trained soldier-doctor capable of going to outer space. It was only until he experienced one of the darkest, most traumatic things a child could go through, that he discovered a calling way bigger than himself.

programme.title: The Rise of Wim Hof
programme.desc: S1:E1 The Iceman (Wim Hof), a man seemingly immune to freezing temperatures, who once climbed Mount Everest only in his shorts and shoes sounds like a fictional superhero. But Wim isn’t invincible to pain, in fact, the opposite. The worst tragedy he’s suffered was the catalyst that inspired him to master his mind and body and help millions do the same.

programme.title: Amber Rose vs. Kanye West
programme.desc: S1:E5 it true that Kanye West was harassing Amber Rose when she suddenly left him? When Kanye West started dating Amber Rose, he took her from the life of being a stripper to the global superstar world. At first, they seemed like a couple that was truly in love. But when Amber suddenly left Kanye, his attitude towards her completely changed. Our team uncovered the real story behind the tabloids of the years of bullying, unwanted media attention, and attacks that Amber had to suffer. The true story will reveal why she was the special woman Kanye fell in love with in the first place, and what she and Kim Kardashian have in common.

programme.title: The Kardashians vs. Jordyn Woods
programme.desc: S1:E4 Jordyn Woods was somebody the Kardashian family trusted. But all that changed when rumours of her being a home wrecker emerged after a scandalous yet confusing night at a party with Khloé Kardashian’s then-boyfriend and NBA player, Tristan Thompson. Our team investigated both sides of the story and got the real truth about what happened that night.

programme.title: Katy Perry vs. Russell Brand
programme.desc: S1:E7 Katy Perry is no stranger to toxic relationships. She finally thought she landed the perfect one with bad boy comedian Russell Brand, only for him to divorce her through text message right in the middle of her world tour 2 years later. Our team uncovered the full story of the turbulent aftermath and the journey she went on to become a strong, authentic person who was finally able to fully embrace a healthy relationship.

programme.title: Nicole Kidman vs. Tom Cruise
programme.desc: S1:E9 Was Scientology the reason why Tom Cruise divorced Nicole Kidman? Nicole was obsessed with Tom. She tried to do everything she could to be with the superstar at all times. But Tom had another obsession: Scientology. Then, when Tom Cruise suddenly divorced Nicole, the world she thought she was living in shattered into a million pieces. Was it because of Scientology? Was it the multiple miscarriages she had? Was it the wiretap Tom allegedly put on Nicole? This story was so uncovered, that our team had to dig deep to get the details.

programme.title: Drake Bell vs. Josh Peck
programme.desc: S1:E15 Everyone loved Drake & Josh but people don’t know the dark story behind the world’s favorite kids’ show. Josh struggled with his weight and addiction while filming the show. It was always painful for him to be the chubby sidekick to the cool, popular Drake. Then Josh shocked the world when he revealed that he and Drake weren’t even really friends. Drake was furious, sparking a massive backlash against Josh. But no one knew just how dark of a path Drake had gone down.

programme.title: Hawking's Last Message to Humanity
programme.desc: Famous cosmologist and all-around inspirational human Stephen Hawking delivers a final speech before he departed us for worlds beyond.

programme.title: Trade Checklist: Iron Condor

programme.title: Episode 16 Setting Up an Options Trade From Start to Finish _ Options Crash Course
programme.desc: With tastytrades Options Crash Course coming to a close, its time to put everything weve learned together to build a trade from the ground up. What we see is that by using portfolio theta, portfolio delta, and implied volatility rank (IVR), were able to execute a trade with very little subjectivity used in the analysis.

programme.title: Episode 7 Trade Management: Gamma and Options
programme.desc: In todays episode, we dive headfirst into gamma, or deltas change as stock prices change. Gamma is used to actively monitor our portfolios, but its important to recognize what is important and what is not. While the sign of gamma is critically important for us to understand our positions, the actual magnitude of gamma is far less important. As we manage our positions at 21 DTE, were naturally able to control any gamma risk that might otherwise be associated with our positions.

programme.title: Saschiz Old Town, Romania
programme.desc: Saschiz, village, and commune, Mureș județ county is located in central Romania. The villages of Saschiz, Mihai Viteazu, and Cloașterf make up the larger commune of Saschiz. Located in the old region of Transylvania, it lies about 20 km east of Sighișoara"&". First documented in the 14th century, Saschiz is known for its medieval fortress and church constructed by Transylvanian Saxons, a German speaker. They settled in Transylvania when it was part of Hungary. The ruins of the 14th-century fortress sit atop "&"a hill overlooking the village. The late 15th-century fortified church has Gothic details and an imposing clock tower. Along with five other villages with fortified churches, Saschiz was inscribed on UNESCO’s World Heritage sites in 1999.

High Life HD
programme.desc: Teton Gravity Research's 2003 ski and snowboard movie challenges the hype and dares you to see what freeskiing and snowboarding have become. High Life documents the very best of riding and culture.

programme.title: Paradise Waits
programme.desc: Sony Mind's Eye is a series of self-edits by Teton Gravity Research athletes. Episode 3 features footage captured while filming for Paradise Waits, TGR's 2015 snowsports film.

programme.title: White Wedding
programme.desc: In Jackson Hole, Wyoming, the relentless winter of 2017 was one for the record books. Relive this epic 600 inch season in Storm Show’s newest ski/ride/adrenaline film White Wedding. Highlights include: neck deep powder, massive airs & probable first descents, the show-stopping snowpocalypse event, and a 40 mile expedition into the heart of the Wind River Range.

programme.title: Sea Kayaking the Caves of the Magdalen Islands
programme.desc: A breathtaking chain of islands located far from anywhere else in the Gulf of the St. Lawrence, les Îles de la Madeleine are unlike anything you've ever seen. Join host, Ken Whiting, as he sea kayaks and swims along the stunning coastline, explores amazing sea caves and discovers the unique pleasures of island living.

programme.title: Wadi Rum
programme.desc: Set in the expansive landscape of Jordan’s distinctive national park, “Wadi Rum” documents the unlikely story of two Israeli climbers, an affable Bedouin Muslim, and a professional American climber as they work together to complete a climbing route up Wadi Rums’ largest rock formation. Three years ago, Israeli climbers Eliav (Eli) Nissan and Elad Omer began working on the ‘Sultan El-Mujahidin,’ in an effort to re-introduce this area back into the modern climbing community.

programme.title: Global Convoy
programme.desc: A bunch of penniless goons are determined to see the world and meet all the wondrous peoples it contains. They buy cars for £150 and totally clueless, set off across Europe, Central Asia, Siberia and then over to the USA and south to Argentina. Years from now, when academics intone about the DIY backlash to a modern society drowning in tech, then this film will be cited.

programme.title: Michelin 12H Misano
programme.desc: Endurance racing heads to Italy as the 24H Series takes on the iconic Misano World Circuit. GTs and touring cars battle through the night in this demanding 12-hour showdown under the lights of the Adriatic coast.

programme.title: GoodWood: Surtees Trophy
programme.desc: The sight of Surtees in a Lola T70 was just as normal as in a Ferrari Formula 1 car

programme.title: The Hell
programme.desc: A close up motorsport mini docuseries about racing on the worlds most prestigious racetrack.

programme.title: The 900 Series
programme.desc: Tony visits Fabspeed to get a custom exhaust fabricated for a 914 project; Joe Fabiani gives Tony a tour of the Fabspeed headquarters

programme.title: Sams Garage
programme.desc: Sam and Phil set up a new outdoor showcase for Sam‚Äôs 67‚Äô Cadillac

programme.title: Peterson Automotive Museum Global Garages
programme.desc: Tim Allen shares his private garage containing a diverse car collection of hot rods, customs, sports cars, and even a Tesla! Some celebrity garages only have new cars, but Tim is a genuine hot rodder and enjoys building cars and driving fast.

programme.title: Bike World
programme.desc: Bridgestone took Chris to Portugal to ride their latest Adventure Tires, so which one is right for you and your bike? Chris spent a couple of weeks with the MV Agusta Superveloce 800, and he even managed to get it on track.

programme.title: Baking & Cooking
programme.desc: Learn to bake and cook with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: The New Millennium - the 2000's
programme.desc: As the new century dawned, fashion had gone from corsets to spandex pants in just 100 years. Even dogs were getting dressed up. Paulette Bell creates a customized dog coat using machine embroidery. Angela Wolf adds a hand warmer to work-out wear for today's trendy touch.

programme.title: Stylish Home
programme.desc: Your home reflects who you are. Using an easy smocking technique, sewing enthusiast Cheryl Sleboda makes colorful, patterned pillows to showcase her style. Blogger Heather Valentine combines unusual materials to create a handy caddy for her studio. With hand-dyed wool and nubby fibers, author Lisa Shepard Stewart stitches a lush wall-hanging.

programme.title: Multitasking for Knitters: Two-at-a-Time Socks
programme.desc: Beat single sock syndrome with a little multitasking! The girls go over how to knit two socks at once so you'll never end up with solo socks again.

programme.title: Fresh for Spring: Knitted Boot Liners, Jewel-tone Shawls & Brioche Police
programme.desc: Time for a little spring fling! Join the Grocery Girls as they gear up for warmer weather by chatting lace, their favorite Instagrammers and even a few tales of love. Well, sort of.

programme.title: Patterns
programme.desc: Patterns are a design, motif or decoration, formed from regular repeated elements. They can also be naturally-occurring or a random arrangement of shapes, colors which have a regular or decorative effect. Patterns can be stripes, or lines, or alternating colors. The first project has a striped pattern of knots tied with plastic lacing. Next, make felt cookies with a polka dot pattern. Then add a chevron pattern to your art journal. Last, create a folding play mat with landscape patterns of a city scene around a lake.

programme.title: Photography
programme.desc: Learn photography with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Lamb Cake
programme.desc: Celebrate spring with an adorable lamb cake and follow along with Rachael Teufel as she demonstrates simple modeling and sculpting techniques. Learn how to use basic shapes to create your lamb's face and ears, plus tips for topping off your lamb with a charming tuft of curly wool.

programme.title: Life In Gaza & Hamas
programme.desc: Unpacking the History of Life in Gaza and Hamas, the duly-designated terrorist organization that controls the Gaza Strip and attacked Israel on October 7, 2023 in the worst terrorist attack in Israeli history.

programme.desc: A daily English-language newscast direct from the State of Israel

programme.title: Weekly Insider
programme.desc: Get an insider look at Israeli politics, from the left, right and center with Israeli politicians, thought leaders and experts.

programme.title: J Docs Presents I Am Here
programme.desc: Holocaust Survivor Ella Blumenthal shares her story of survival on her 98th birthday, through a combination of 2D animation and documentary footage, recounting her imprisonment in three concentration camps, narrowly escaping death in a gas chamber.

programme.title: Izbica Ghetto & Alfred Landecker
programme.desc: Join Polish Historian, Genealogist and Guide Dr. Tomasz Cebulski on an aerial and walking tour, exploring the Izbica Ghetto in the Lublin District in Eastern Poland and the fate of one of its ultimate Jewish inhabitants, Alfred Landecker.

programme.title: Stories of Moral Courage
programme.desc: The Jewish Foundation for the Righteous honors non-Jewish rescuers who saved Jews fleeing from the horrors for Holocaust, including the Bilecki Family (Poland), Ona Urbonas (Lithuania), Irena Walulewicz (Poland) and Wiktoria Sozanka (Poland).

programme.title: Haunted Hogmanay (2006)
programme.desc: Haunted Hogmanay (2020) is a horror-comedy short film set during the Scottish New Year celebration, Hogmanay. The story follows a group of people who experience eerie, supernatural events while celebrating, blending dark humor with traditional folklore. As strange occurrences disrupt the festivities, the characters must confront their fears in a quirky yet chilling atmosphere. The film combines horror with holiday tradition, offering a unique twist on the ghost story genre.

programme.title: International friend
programme.desc: In order to go north to fight against Japan, the Red First Front Army decided to cross the Yellow River east to rush towards the front line of the Anti-Japanese War. Sword of Xingguo was ordered to cross the river secretly on a sheepskin raft in advance, entered Sanjiao Town in Shanxi Province, controlled the ferry, and welcomed the Red Army to cross the river. Then, Sword of Xingguo received an order from the headquarters to go to the blockade to secretly meet American reporter Edgar Snow and doctor Ma Haide. On the way, a political bandit followed them in an attempt to kill the international friend and blame the Red Army. The sword of Xingguo fought with wits and courage to destroy the bandits plot, sending the two international friends safely to the Red Army headquarters. In order to welcome the Fourth Red Army to join forces in the north, Sword of Xingguo was ordered to go to Huining to investigate the enemys situation. On October 2, 1936, the cavalry regiment of the 15th Red Army captured Huining County and went south to guide the Fourth Red Army into Huining. On October 10, the Red First and Red Fourth Front Army joined forces in Huining, Gansu. After the victory of the First and the Fourth Front Army joined forces, the headquarters ordered Sword of Xingguo to carry a radio to look for the Second Red Front Army that was heading north. In mid-October, Sword of Xingguo found the Red Second Front Army at the foot of Liupan Mountain, which was fighting fiercely with the enemy. The Red Second Front Army quickly broke through the encirclement and moved closer to the Shaanxi-Gansu Soviet Area. At the beginning of late-October, the three main forces of the Red First, Second, and Fourth Front Army successfully joined forces in Jiangtaibao, Xiji County, Ningxia, declaring the victory of the Long March.

programme.title: They Will Soon Come Together
programme.desc: Sarah, Slowly, and Greeny are a team with a clear mission: to keep a watchful eye on both sides of the bay. Their dedication and focus are evident as they carry out their roles with precision. Together, they will soon come together to share their insights and ensure the safety and security of those in the area.

programme.title: We Can Overcome Any Obstacle
programme.desc: Although challenges may arise, we must continue to push forward with determination and bravery. Let us face our problems head on, with a resolve that will never falter. Together, we can overcome any obstacle in our path and emerge victorious. Never give up hope, for fortune favors the bold. Let us move forward with courage and strength, towards a brighter tomorrow.

programme.title: Kidnapping Grandpa
programme.desc: The situation with Grandpa Hammer and the Buster Gang can be concerning, but we must not lose hope. Let us trust that there is a reason behind their actions and that our Q-Star League can help bring a positive resolution. The recent earthquake on Statue Mountain may have caused fear and uncertainty, but we believe our community will come together to overcome this crisis. Let us focus on working together toward a brighter future.

programme.title: Buster Gang gets home safely
programme.desc: Amidst the dark and enigmatic cave, a remarkable sight unfolds before our very eyes. An ancient airship, along with its brave Captain Gordon, emerges from the depths, revealing the great secrets of Q-Star. Despite the looming danger, Flame selflessly aids in evacuation, putting himself at risk to save others. As we watch with bated breath, we wonder: will the Captain of the Q-Star league make it out unscathed? And will the Buster Gang be able to return home safely aboard the airship? Let us hope and pray for their safe journey.

programme.title: IN THE CLOSET
programme.desc: 2045, two brothers form the Black Foundation, a movement in the U. S. that suggests the Government apologize to slave descendants for their hardships, and bestow on them reparations by any means necessary.. ..Or Holy Hell will break loose.. Luke, the oldest son, discovers the power and guidance of Christ and tries to save himself but his brother and father as well.Wrong actions brings a Demon into the life of the two brothers:Will Christ prevail, or will the Demons efforts consume the Maxwell Family?
